alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 4:53PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 452 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Paradise Valley to 27 miles east of Orovada to 20 miles northwest of Midas. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paradise Valley and Chimney Dam Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
